intro: Toxocarpus gagnepainii, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pinkish flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated margin. Toxocarpus gagnepainii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in forested areas.
